meanings.definition: The quality or state of being glazed.
meanings.sent1: The glaziness of the pottery made it shiny and smooth.
meanings.sent2: I admired the glaziness of the freshly painted vase.
meanings.sent3: The glaziness of the donut made it look almost too perfect to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a glaziness that hinted at unshed tears.
meanings.sent5: The glaziness of the lake's surface reflected the colors of the sunset beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act or process of applying a glaze to something.
meanings.sent1: The glaziness of the pottery was achieved through careful application of the glaze.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of glaziness by practicing on small ceramic tiles.
meanings.sent3: The glaziness of the cake was the result of a messy glazing attempt.
meanings.sent4: The glaziness of the car's paint job made it look brand new.
meanings.sent5: The glaziness of the artist's brush strokes added depth to the painting.

meanings.definition: The appearance or effect of a glazed surface.
meanings.sent1: The glaziness of the mirror made her reflection appear distorted.
meanings.sent2: The glaziness of the window made it difficult to see through.
meanings.sent3: The glaziness of the ice made it look like a giant crystal.
meanings.sent4: The glaziness of the floor tiles made them slippery when wet.
meanings.sent5: The glaziness of the photograph gave it a glossy finish.
